title: Citi: Aluminum will face a structural shortage in 2026, raising the price target
summary: Citi forecasts a structural bull market in aluminum with a minor deficit of 61,000 tons in 2026, widening to 847,000 tons in 2027. The bank raised its 0-3 month price target from USD 2,950 to USD 3,400 per ton, citing domestic demand recovery and supply constraints. Policy signals from China and robust exports support prices into early 2026.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,170.25 USD/T on January 15, 2026, down 0.51%, after dropping to 3,153 USD/T the previous day. Over the past month, prices rose 9.41%, up 19.66% year-over-year. On January 13, aluminum hovered near 3-year highs around $3,090 per tonne amid tighter supply.

title: Price increase on aluminum effective Jan. 1, 2026
summary: Petersen is implementing a 10% price adjustment on aluminum sheets, coils, and panels effective January 1, 2026, due to rising raw material costs. Updated pricing will be shared in advance. The company will monitor market conditions for further updates.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Aluminum futures surged above $3,000 per ton on the LME, the highest in over three years, due to tightening global supply and demand from construction and renewables. Factors include China's overcapacity curbs, high energy costs, and smelter disruptions. There were six price increases for aluminum wire in 2025.

title: U.S. aluminum prices hit record highs amid tariffs, low supply
summary: U.S. aluminum prices rose 40% to over $5,200 per ton since 50% tariffs were imposed, with the Midwest premium hitting a record 96 cents per pound. Global supply shortfalls and low inventories exacerbate tariff impacts, raising costs for automotive, aerospace, and construction. LME prices are up over 20% in 12 months.

title: Aluminum prices soar on Trump tariffs, global shortages, and China curbs
summary: U.S. buyers face record Midwest premiums amid 50% Trump tariffs and global aluminum shortages of 2 million tons annually. All-in costs exceed $4,792 per ton including LME base, freight, and duties which nearly tripled. Tariffs drive spikes as exporters divert to Europe, shrinking U.S. stocks.

title: Aluminium's Rally Tests A Tight Physical Market And A Policy-Driven Price Map
summary: Aluminum prices hit near $3,158 per ton amid thinning stocks and diverging regional premiums. U.S. all-in costs exceed $5,200 per ton post-tariffs, with Midwest premium at record 96 cents/lb. Europe's carbon border costs reshape trade, but momentum may pause.

title: LME aluminium prices remain elevated above USD 3100/t on tight global supply - 14 January 2026
summary: LME aluminum trades above USD 3,100 per tonne due to structural supply tightness and falling exchange stocks. Global supply constraints support elevated prices.

title: Citi: Aluminum will face a structural shortage in 2026, raising the ...
summary: Citi forecasts a structural aluminum shortage in 2026 with a deficit of 61,000 tons, shifting from supply constraints and supported by recovering Chinese demand and policy signals. The bank raised its short-term price target to USD 3,400 per ton amid expected export rushes due to policy changes on photovoltaic products. This supports a structural bull market in aluminum.

title: This week, the macro cycle rebounded, aluminum | SMM - Metal News
summary: This week, macroeconomic cycles rebounded, leading to unexpected destocking in aluminum inventories. Aluminum prices showed a steady rise as a result. The report highlights positive momentum in the aluminum market.

title: The 2026 Aluminum Squeeze: Why This Industrial Metal is Outperforming the S&P 500
summary: The global aluminum market faces a structural price squeeze due to supply bottlenecks, including Guinea's bauxite processing shift and China's production cap at 45 million tonnes, reducing exports. High demand from green economy sectors like EVs and aerospace exacerbates shortages, with prices above $3,200 per tonne risking demand destruction. Key watches include US Midwest Premium and potential Chinese production increases.

title: Aluminium Bahrain achieves historic production and safety records in 2025
summary: Aluminium Bahrain (Alba) set a production record of 1,623,139 metric tonnes in 2025, exceeding the prior year's 1,622,261 tonnes despite a late-year industrial fire. The company also achieved over 42 million injury-free work hours, marking two full years without lost time injuries. Alba plans further efficiency improvements.

title: Aluminium moulds 2026 with higher prices: DISR
summary: Aluminum prices spiked to US$3,185 per tonne as of January 13, 2026, up from Q3 2025 averages, with DISR forecasting further rises of US$150 per tonne in 2026 driven by clean energy demand in EVs, wind turbines, and solar. Australia produced 1.58 million tonnes in 2024, ranking seventh globally with four major smelters. The global transition to renewables boosts aluminum needs.

title: Automakers Brace for 2026 Cost Squeeze as Chip, Metal Prices Soar
summary: China's automakers face rising 2026 costs from soaring prices of aluminum, copper, chips, and lithium carbonate, potentially adding thousands of yuan per vehicle. Li Auto's supply chain VP warns of a near 50% chip shortfall. UBS highlights the mounting financial pressures amid climbing input costs.

title: Bank of America: Optimistic about metal investment opportunities in the year of the red horse, with aluminum stocks as the top choice
summary: Bank of America is optimistic on 2026 metal investments, favoring aluminum stocks amid demand boosts from 10% grid investment growth and 27% rise in EV battery needs. Key producers like China Aluminum Corporation, Zijin Mining, and China Hongqiao are highlighted for their scale and advantages. China's alumina market shows persistent surplus with production adjustments.

title: Coolbrook Named on the 2026 Global Cleantech 100
summary: Coolbrook, a technology company focused on industrial decarbonization, has been named to the 2026 Global Cleantech 100 list. Their RotoDynamic Technology, including RotoDynamic Reactor and Heater, enables carbon-free heating up to 1700°C for sectors like petrochemicals, steel, and cement, potentially cutting 30% of heavy industry CO2 emissions. The recognition highlights their role in sustainable innovation for critical minerals and industrial processes.

title: Aluminum Sustainability: Circular Economy & Recycling
summary: The article explores how aluminum sustainability is transforming manufacturing via a circular economy model. It emphasizes recycling's 95% energy efficiency compared to primary production. This approach promotes resource conservation and environmental benefits in aluminum production.

title: [CES Innovation Awards® 2026 Honoree] Portable SSD T7 Resurrected
summary: Samsung's Portable SSD T7 Resurrected won a CES 2026 Innovation Award for its 100% recycled aluminum enclosure made from smartphone production scrap. The design maximizes circular material use, including recycled paper packaging, to reduce environmental impact. It represents cross-division collaboration advancing Samsung's sustainable design strategy.

title: Business Intelligence Group Honors Axalta AL with Six BIG Innovation Awards
summary: Axalta AL received six BIG Innovation Awards from the Business Intelligence Group. These awards recognize innovations that support sustainability by reducing emissions, conserving resources, and enhancing operational efficiency. The honors highlight Axalta's contributions to eco-friendly coating technologies.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel traded flat at 939 USD/T on January 16, 2026, after falling to 938.08 USD/T on January 15, down 0.10% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.53%, and are up 35.11% year-over-year. Forecasts indicate trading at 959.80 USD/T by quarter-end and 1032.31 USD/T in 12 months.

title: January 16, 2026, Jinshi Futures Morning Report: The Trump Administration
summary: China Iron and Steel Association reports key steel enterprises produced 19.97 million tons of crude steel in early January, up 21.6% from prior period, estimating national daily output at 2.48 million tons. Mysteel data shows rebar production at 1.903 million tons for week ending January 15, down 0.39%, while apparent demand rose 8.79%. LME base metals mostly declined amid ferrous metals updates.

title: Major steel and raw material futures prices in China - January 15, 2026
summary: Rebar futures at Shanghai Futures Exchange closed at RMB 3,160/mt ($451/mt) on January 15, 2026. Other steel products like HRC listed with weekly changes; iron ore down 0.73%, scrap up 0.88%. Turkish rebar index up 0.17%, reflecting mixed regional trends.

title: Taiwan's CSC announces new steel prices for Jan and Q1 2026
summary: Taiwan's CSC raised monthly contract prices for hot-rolled coils, cold-rolled coils, and hot-rolled plates by NT$300/ton for January. Quarterly prices for Q1 2026 remain mostly flat, except for specified adjustments. This reflects ongoing market pricing strategies into the new year.

title: US raw steel production is up 2.8 percent - week 1, 2026
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 10, 2026, reached 1.752 million net tons, up 2.8% from the previous week and 3.1% from the same week in 2025, with a capacity utilization rate of 75.7%. Adjusted year-to-date production through January 10 was 2.482 million net tons at 75.3% capacity utilization, a 2.6% increase from last year.

title: US' raw steel production in week ending Jan 10 hikes w-o-w, y-o-y
summary: US raw steel production for the week ending January 10, 2026, showed increases week-over-week and year-over-year. Adjusted year-to-date production reached 2.482 million net tons, up 2.6% from the previous year.

title: US crude steel production increased by 3.1% in the week ending January 10
summary: US crude steel production rose 3.1% for the week ending January 10, 2026, compared to the prior year, according to AISI data. Regional production in the Northeast was 123,000 net tons.

title: Latin American steel sector expects stronger safeguards, clearer landscape in 2026
summary: Latin American steel producers anticipate stronger safeguards against Chinese imports in 2026, including Mexico's new tariffs on Asian steel effective January 1, which may curb supply and raise hot-rolled coil prices. The region's manufacturing is eroding due to distorted prices from China's excess capacity, prompting efforts to regionalize North American supply chains.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is rebounding with innovations like lower-carbon electric arc mini-mills that recycle scrap steel, reducing emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra are advancing coal-free processes using electricity and chemical reactions, making production more efficient and cost-competitive than traditional methods or even China. These technologies promise full decarbonization of steelmaking amid rising investor interest.

title: Coolbrook Named on the 2026 Global Cleantech 100
summary: Coolbrook has been recognized on the 2026 Global Cleantech 100 for its RotoDynamic Technology, which replaces fossil fuel burning in heavy industries like iron and steel with electrification. The technology's RotoDynamic Reactor and Heater achieve temperatures up to 1700°C for carbon-free production, potentially cutting 2.4 billion tons of annual CO2 emissions. It supports rapid decarbonization in steel, cement, and chemicals sectors.

title: Business Intelligence Group Honors Axalta with Six BIG Innovation Awards
summary: Axalta received awards for coatings innovations enhancing sustainability in automotive and industrial applications, including electrical steel coatings for efficient electric motors. Technologies like Lumeera 3250 low-bake clearcoat reduce CO2 emissions by at least 20% per vehicle by curing at lower temperatures. Other solutions offer energy savings up to 40%, zero VOCs, and high transfer efficiency for cabinet coatings.

title: Kamoa Copper Mine Achieves Production Target, LME Copper
summary: LME copper opened at $13,082/mt and fluctuated between $12,928/mt and $13,162.5/mt before closing at $13,148.5/mt, down 1.14%. The report covers spot prices across Shanghai, Guangdong, and imported copper markets, with Guangdong spot copper cathode showing increased premiums of 100-160 yuan/mt against the front-month contract.

title: High copper prices persist in early 2026
summary: Copper prices have surged nearly 20% to a record of US$13,310/t on January 12, 2026, driven by strong fundamentals, trading activity, and financial flows. Geopolitical tensions, macroeconomic uncertainty, and M&A activity are expected to keep prices elevated, with prices forecast to remain volatile but supported above US$13,000/t over the next three months.

title: US Trade Policy Uncertainty & Supply Disruptions Push Copper Beyond $13,000
summary: Copper's breach of $13,000/t reflects structural constraints rather than cyclical demand, driven by US tariffs on semi-finished copper, pending policy reviews due June 2026, and Chilean supply disruptions including the Mantoverde mine strike. Low exchange inventories and forward-buying behavior have compressed spot availability globally while inflating US premiums.

title: Copper price extends hot start to year, tin price breaks record
summary: Copper reached an all-time high of $13,310/t on the London Metal Exchange, with the metal up 6% in the first two weeks of 2026. Positive demand forecasts from AI and renewable energy sectors, combined with supply concerns and geopolitical uncertainties, are driving the bull narrative, though Goldman Sachs predicts a short-term consolidation period.

title: Copper pulls back from record on fading US tariff concerns and firmer dollar
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange slipped 0.8% to $13,082/mt after touching a record high of $13,407/mt, reflecting pullback from recent peaks amid shifting market sentiment.

title: Kamoa Copper Mine Achieves Production Target, LME Copper ...
summary: Ivanhoe Mines announced that the Kamoa-Kakula copper mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo achieved its 2025 production guidance with approximately 388,838 mt of copper concentrate. The company's new copper smelter commenced operations at the end of 2025 and is ramping up capacity to reduce costs and generate by-product revenue. The zinc mine also hit record production.

title: Capstone Copper Achieves Production Guidance
summary: Capstone Copper reported record 2025 copper production of 224,764 tonnes, exceeding guidance and up 22% from 2024. Growth was driven by the Mantoverde Development Project and Mantos Blancos debottlenecking, with a record quarterly output of 58,273 tonnes in December. Despite a strike, Mantoverde operates at 75% capacity, and shares surged post-announcement.

title: Why Capstone Copper, Catalyst Metals, DroneShield, and Wildcat shares are rising today
summary: Capstone Copper achieved its FY 2025 production guidance with record 224,764 tonnes of copper, up 22% year-over-year due to key project executions. CEO Cashel Meagher highlighted transformational growth from catalysts like Mantoverde. Shares rose 7.5% following the announcement.

title: First Quantum backs Panama's plan to allow stockpile processing at shut copper mine
summary: First Quantum Minerals supports Panama's plan to process stockpiles at the shut Cobre Panama copper mine. The company awaits formal approvals to coordinate activities with the government. This could enable some production resumption from existing materials.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
source: Rio Tinto / Mining Weekly / Engineering News
summary: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services have partnered to deploy Nuton copper technology at U.S. data centers. The technology is projected to use substantially less water and generate lower carbon emissions than conventional concentrator-based copper production methods.

title: Copper supplies set to peak just as tech needs more
summary: A fresh S&P Global study warns that copper demand will likely outstrip production within a decade as electrification, electric vehicles, and AI-driven IT infrastructure accelerate demand. The report calls for streamlined permitting, stable investment frameworks, new technology, and expanded processing capacity to address the supply-demand gap.

title: Copper in the Age of AI: Challenges of Electrification
summary: S&P Global's report examines copper's critical role in electrification and digitalization, highlighting that over 90% of new electric generating capacity installed in 2025 was solar and wind, both copper-intensive. The report emphasizes the urgency of policy action, investment, and innovation across the copper value chain to prevent copper from becoming a bottleneck to growth.

title: Commodities in 2026: 10 Numbers to Watch From Power to Oil
summary: Bloomberg NEF reports that the copper supply and demand balance swings by 1 million metric tons into a deficit in 2026, driven by data centers and electric vehicles. A tight copper market signals higher price risk and potential supply-chain constraints for electrification projects.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Experienced a Significant Correction on January 16
summary: On January 16, SMM #1 refined nickel prices ranged from 144,700-154,000 yuan/mt, averaging 149,350 yuan/mt, down 700 yuan/mt from the previous day. Spot premiums for Jinchuan #1 refined nickel averaged 6,500 yuan/mt, down 1,500 yuan/mt. The SHFE nickel contract (2602) closed the morning session at 142,540 yuan/mt, down 3.19%, amid central bank rate cuts.

title: [SMM Nickel Flash] January 16 — Supply side, upstream offers remained at 1,050-1,100 yuan/mtu
summary: On January 16, upstream offers for nickel remained stable at 1,050-1,100 yuan/mtu, with some iron plants holding firm. A price hike failed to boost demand, as cautious sentiment persists in the market.

title: In Case You Missed It - BC Extra Upgrades & Downgrades - 16-01-26
summary: Canaccord Genuity upgrades Nickel Industries Limited to Buy, raising the target to $1.05 from $0.80 due to higher nickel price forecasts and base metals strength. The broker expects weaker nickel prices to impact EBITDA but sees upside from revised metal price outlooks, including copper.

title: First Atlantic Nickel Highlights Relevance of Pipestone XL Awaruite Nickel-Cobalt Alloy Discovery to Address U.S. Critical Mineral Supply Chain Vulnerabilities Identified in January 14, 2026 White House Proclamation
summary: First Atlantic Nickel highlights preliminary metallurgical testing at Pipestone XL yielding a 1.3% nickel and cobalt magnetic concentrate from near-surface zones, with ongoing work to upgrade it to ~60% via flotation. The project also evaluates chromium recovery as a potential by-product for stainless steel production. Upcoming drill programs aim to expand the nickel alloy project following recent financing.

title: Vale Indonesia secures mining quota approval for 2026
summary: Nickel miner PT Vale Indonesia has secured approval for its 2026 mining quota, allowing all operational activities to return to normal. The company did not disclose the specific volume of nickel ore permitted for production this year.

title: Nickel price hits nine-month high as Indonesia plans to cut output
summary: Nickel prices reached a nine-month high after Indonesia, the top producer accounting for nearly 70% of global supply, announced plans to reduce 2026 output to better match supply with demand and boost prices. The government will tighten mining quotas (RKABs) amid rising LME stockpiles and disappointing battery demand. Prices rose as much as 4.7% to $16,560 per ton.

title: Nickel and cobalt out, CO2 in at Turnagain
summary: The Turnagain nickel-cobalt project is shifting focus from nickel and cobalt production to CO2 sequestration. Details on the operational changes at the site were reported in the latest update.

title: First Quantum Minerals Announces 2025 Preliminary Production and 2026-2028 Guidance
summary: First Quantum Minerals released preliminary 2025 production figures and provided guidance for nickel and other metals through 2028. The announcement details expected output capacities in U.S. dollars.

title: GT reassesses Finnish nickel-PGM project
summary: GT Resources is reassessing its Kaukua nickel-PGM project in Finland by analyzing over 4,600 historic pulps and 500 infill samples to standardize data. The program aims to update resource estimates ahead of potential development.

title: Battery Metals: The Strategic Investment Case for 2026
summary: Nickel demand is projected to double to 5-6 million tonnes by 2030, driven by EV battery production using NMC and NCA chemistries. Canada Nickel innovates with carbon sequestration via IPT technology, NetCarb partnerships, and carbon injection pilots aiming for net-negative carbon footprint. Lifezone Metals advances hydrometallurgical processing at Kabanga Nickel for superior economics.

title: Clean energy supply chains of the future need a circular economy
summary: A circular economy provides resilient supply for critical minerals like nickel amid post-COP30 clean energy push. Recycling nickel and others cuts GHG emissions by ~80% versus mining, aiding compliance with tightening regulations. Discussions at 2026 Annual Meeting focus on balancing environmental protection and growth.

title: Recycling critical materials for a sustainable future
summary: Recycling critical materials like nickel bolsters supply chains, cuts foreign reliance, and lowers carbon footprints for sustainability. EU mandates rising recycled content in batteries, including 6% nickel by 2031, advancing circular economy goals. Vertically integrated battery recycling is key to securing domestic supplies amid EV growth.

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal Expands Pipe Coating Business
summary: Tenaris has acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems for district heating and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The business unit has been rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, focusing on anti-corrosion coatings for oil and gas pipelines applied at Tenaris facilities in Italy, Mexico, Argentina, and Brazil. This strategic move aims to reduce delivery times, ensure quality, lower costs, and minimize environmental impact.

title: Hydrogen to decarbonize steel: first trial launched in Italy
summary: Tenaris, Snam, and Tenova have launched Italy's first trial using hydrogen at a steel plant in Dalmine, Bergamo, to process steel products in a reheating furnace for hot rolling seamless pipes. The six-month trial evaluates hydrogen performance, reliability, safety guidelines, and plant procedures to lower CO2 emissions in hard-to-abate sectors. It supports Tenaris's goal to reduce its carbon footprint by 30% by 2030.

title: Tenaris, Snam & Tenova to launch first hydrogen trial at steel plant in Italy
summary: Tenaris, Snam, and Tenova are launching Italy's first trial using hydrogen at a steel plant to process steel products over six months. The initiative tests hydrogen in steel industry applications, focusing on performance and reliability in decarbonizing challenging sectors.

title: Tenaris (TS) repurchases 3.32M shares in week under USD1.2B buyback program
summary: Tenaris repurchased 3,320,025 shares for €54.6 million (USD 64.2 million) in a week as part of its USD 1.2 billion buyback program. Following the transactions, the company holds 62,328,172 ordinary shares in treasury, representing 5.81% of its total issued share capital, with plans to cancel them in due course.
